productDesc: An elegant, light bodied wine with a ton of red fruit and an earthy undertone
An intense, structured wine, great with grilled meats and tomato sauces
Naturally fermented, the peppery dark fruit complements a funky nose
Lively red fruit and a light body with round, mellow tannins
A cooler climate cab, medium bodied with great acid and an herbal finish
In the Rhone Valley tradition, white pepper and a slight gaminess complement the black currant
Intense but silky tannins lead to jammy raspberry, blackberry, and dark cherry
Intensely structured, this wine needs a few years to soften the astringent dark fruit
A Meritage blend intended for early consumption, round fruits and mellow tannins
Ripe red fruit and structure make this wine a great pairing for lighter meats
An expression of the Osoyoos desert climate, the ripe tannins of this wine pair beatifully with dark chocolate
The power of the pyramid imbues this wine with mystical qualities (also, Justin Trudeau liked it)

productName: Caduceus Nagual de la Naga Blend
productDesc: In the mountains of Jerome, Arizona, winery owner James Maynard Keenan fought off wild boar with a shotgun to protect the grapes that made this wine
A focused, Syrah based blend, this wine pairs amazingly well with their restaurant's Lamb Malbar Curry
Perfect for summer days, this wine is somehow light bodied and creamy with fresh watermelon and field strawberry flavours
A medium bodied rose, notes of stewed raspberry and cherry tart
An odd blend of 95% Zweigelt and 5% Schonberger, this rose is a favourite of Barb Phillip MW
Saignee method Malbec and Merlot, rich body with raspberry and sweet pink grapefruit, clean finish
Light bodied with sour cherry, grapefruit and satsuma
In the winemaker's words "made for the pure, hedonistic sake" of the wine itself
Naturally fermented in concrete eggs, the lees contact adds richness to key lime and gooseberry
A trip on the palette, a light bodied Chardonnay with full skin contact, adding astringency and a bergamot nose
Fermenting in French oak, malolactic fermantation, and finishing with lees contact gives a buttery creaminess to add to the natural citrus notes of the Chardonnay
Sauvignon Blanc aged in French oak, toffee and caramel complement the natural acidity of the grape
Fermented and aged in neutral French oak barrels, a funky, creamy complexity adds to the lime peel and margarita flavours
The bracing acidity of Chenin Blanc is softened by a short period on the lees
Lime margarita and Sour Patch Kids flavours make this a perfect pairing with fish dishes like ceviche or sushi
Bright lime citrus with a sharp acidity lend a versatility to this wine with food pairings
We didn't misspell Sauvignon Blanc! Savignin Blanc is the parent grape of both Riesling and Gewurztraminer, with a light body and beatiful citrus bouquet
Possibly one of the coolest bottles of sparkling wine you'll ever see, this traditional method sparkling spent 13 years on the lees, lending a rich brioche and lemon custard flavour
Traditional method Riesling, only spending a short time on the lees retains the bright, citrus character of the Riesling but with a creamy mousse
100% estate grown East Kelowna Chardonnay, Traditional method, 3 years on the lees. Pop a bottle and celebrate dammit!
Tradtional method with Champagne varieties, this opulent sparkling has a note of dill on the nose. For high rollers

productName: Okanagan Crush Pad Narrative Ancient Method
productDesc: Ancient method, fully fermented in the bottle, this wine is a great example of the unconventional style of OK Crush Pad
This lively brut is the perfect companion for a hot summer day on the patio
White sparkling wine from Pinot Noir grapes, raspberry Campino candies with a little funk
It's not Port, it's Port-style wine (try suing us now Portugal!). Opulent dark fruit and sweet spice, enjoy in front of a fireplace in a velvet robe
The OGs of the botrytis game, this Sauvignon Blanc dessert wine is exactly what it should be: luscious, packed with citrus, and totally funky
A fortified Ehrenfelser, a juxtaposition of tropical fruit, luscious sweetness, and a biting finish
Always one to defy expectations, this winery's solera-aged Muscat resists labels

productName: Spearhead Botrytis Affected Late Harvest Riesling
productDesc: A happy accident: a few days of dense fog allowed Botrytis to infect a small portion of the Riesling crop, resulting in beautiful funkiness
The first winery to make Icewine in Canada in 1976, their current winemaker follows his ancestor's instructions in a book written in German from the 1400s
The name referring to the thin sheet of ice that covers frozen grapes, this winery was doubly lucky having both the conditions for Botrytis to develop as well as Icewine temperatures
Using a solera system, this Tawny Port-style wine is the perfect accompaniment to Christmas Eve by a fireplace
Start with Naramata grown Tempranillo, fortify with brandy made from the same grapes, and finish with a pinch of Tempranillo Icewine and you end up with a totally unique wine
The epitome of DIY, Syrah and Merlot is fermented in concrete eggs, then fortified with brandy made on-site
Classic but elegant, hand-blown crystal allows you to enjoy your fine vintage in style
Your friend Jim with the $10,000 Bordeaux collection will find these glasses "acceptable"
Pour a glass of Chardonnay, and find a Ryan Reynolds movie on Netflix
Small but mighty, feel like a professional using these WSET approved tasting glasses. Also great for Port!
You might not be able to swirl well with them, but who cares when you slay rose on the patio
Pump out that nasty oxygen, keeping your wine fresher longer. Includes three pump caps
A waiter and bartender's best friend, this crank will never let you down when you're in the weeds
For when you're dressed to impress and a simple waiter's corkscrew won't do
Save the environment in style. Holds two bottles!
